summary: The American Housing and Economic Mobility Act of 2025, as described in the text, addresses various aspects of housing affordability and related issues. It proposes grants for local housing innovation, investments in affordable housing infrastructure, and conditions on property sales. The bill also covers down payment assistance for first-time homebuyers, strengthens community reinvestment, removes barriers to community integration, and reforms estate tax. Furthermore, it includes accessibility requirements for housing and amends the Fair Housing Act, along with provisions related to credit unions, public welfare caps, and veteran housing loans.
